intro: Anthurium striatum, commonly known as the red anthurium, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking, heart-shaped leaves with a dark green surface and prominent white veins. The plant produces vibrant red spathes that enclose its spadix, which is a unique floral structure typical of the Araceae family. Anthurium striatum thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for indoor and greenhouse cultivation.
